topics.title: Introduction and Background
topics.summary: Andy frames mental health warning signs as disruptions to core functions (sleep, relationships, health). Lenny introduces Andy’s career arc and the episode’s focus on burnout and transformation.

topics.title: Sponsor Break
topics.summary: Sponsor reads for Mercury and Coda, describing their products and offers for startups.

topics.title: Choosing honesty and setting episode tone
topics.summary: Lenny and Andy acknowledge the conversation will be heavy. Andy shares his commitment to living openly and not hiding difficult parts of his experience.

topics.title: Career success alongside hidden inner struggle
topics.summary: Andy summarizes 17 years in startups with outward success but worsening emotional, psychological, and spiritual health. He describes the mismatch between professional peak and personal low point.

topics.title: Panic attacks at Twitter and burnout onset
topics.summary: Andy recounts 2010 at Twitter: near-constant panic attacks, depression, sleep issues, and leaving work abruptly to avoid breakdowns. He explains how he masked symptoms while functioning professionally.

topics.title: Root causes: achievement addiction and childhood trauma
topics.summary: Andy connects burnout to two forces: accumulating career pressure and resurfacing buried grief/trauma from his mother’s severe mental illness and death when he was 10. He describes learning to equate achievement with love and self-worth.

topics.title: How common burnout is in tech
topics.summary: Andy shares that through writing, surveys, and research, he estimates 50–60% of tech employees with 5–7+ years experience face meaningful emotional/psychological distress. He emphasizes how symptoms creep up gradually then hit suddenly.

topics.title: Walking away from peak career and hospitalization
topics.summary: Andy describes leaving high-paying senior roles (Wealthfront president, VC founding partner) after a heart scare and ultimately a 45-day mental health institute stay. He frames it as recognizing a once-helpful adaptation (achievement for worth) had become harmful.

topics.title: What Andy does now: advocacy, veterans, coaching
topics.summary: Andy explains his current work in mental health advocacy, including board service with Heroic Hearts Project supporting psychedelic-assisted therapy for veterans with PTSD. He also writes and coaches high performers.

topics.title: Clues.Life and personalized paths to healing
topics.summary: Andy introduces Clues.Life as a library to help people find approaches that fit their unique experiences. He argues mental health tools must be personalized rather than treated as universal truths.

topics.title: Four-step framework for deep personal transformation
topics.summary: Andy outlines a transformation sequence: suffering → seeking truth → self-compassion/self-love → compassion for others. He explains how identity rewires and can reshape relationships, career, and life choices.

topics.title: Fear of change and ego resistance
topics.summary: They discuss why people avoid transformation: it can feel like the ‘death’ of an old identity. Andy describes letting go of achievement-based identity as a gradual process of releasing control.

topics.title: How to seek truth: therapy and journaling practices
topics.summary: Andy recommends starting with therapy (or spiritual guidance) to get routed to helpful modalities, and offers journaling as an alternative. He suggests identifying moments of strong emotional reactivity and repeatedly asking ‘why’ until an uncomfortable or clarifying truth emerges.

topics.title: Recognizing when it’s more than normal stress
topics.summary: Andy lists red-alarm indicators: disrupted sleep, strained relationships, declining physical health, and other core-function breakdowns. He cites his own heart scare and physical symptoms, and recommends The Body Keeps the Score as a guide to how trauma shows up in the body.

topics.title: Sponsor Break
topics.summary: Sponsor read for Miro, highlighting collaborative whiteboards and Lenny’s templates available via a custom board.

topics.title: Building self-compassion through daily rewiring
topics.summary: Andy explains self-compassion isn’t instant; it requires rewiring long-held negative beliefs through awareness and repeated small interventions (e.g., accepting compliments). He notes some people accelerate change via retreats, psychedelics, or endurance challenges, but emphasizes consistent practice.
